tips.title: Quickly Minimize All Windows
tips.description: Instantly minimize all open windows to access your desktop quickly.
steps: Press Windows + D
All windows will be minimized
Press Windows + D again to restore windows

tips.title: Quick Screenshot with Snipping Tool
tips.description: Take screenshots quickly using the built-in Windows Snipping Tool.
steps: Press Windows + Shift + S
Select the area you want to capture
The screenshot is copied to clipboard
Paste it anywhere with Ctrl + V

tips.title: Virtual Desktops
tips.description: Create and manage multiple virtual desktops for better organization.
steps: Press Windows + Tab to open Task View
Click 'New desktop' in the top-left corner
Switch between desktops with Windows + Ctrl + Left/Right arrows
Close desktops by hovering and clicking the X

tips.title: Quick File Search
tips.description: Search for files and applications instantly from the Start menu.
steps: Press Windows key
Start typing the name of the file or application
Press Enter to open the first result
Use arrow keys to navigate through results

tips.title: Window Snapping
tips.description: Snap windows to different parts of the screen for better multitasking.
steps: Drag a window to the left or right edge to snap it to half screen
Use Windows + Left/Right arrow to snap active window
Drag to corners for quarter-screen snapping
Windows + Up arrow maximizes the window

tips.title: Spotlight Search
tips.description: Quickly search for files, applications, and information on your Mac.
steps: Press Cmd + Space
Type what you're looking for
Press Enter to open the first result
Use arrow keys to navigate results

tips.title: Mission Control
tips.description: View all open windows and desktops at once for easy navigation.
steps: Press F3 or swipe up with four fingers
View all open windows and spaces
Click on a window to switch to it
Drag windows between spaces

tips.title: Quick Screenshot
tips.description: Take various types of screenshots using keyboard shortcuts.
steps: Cmd + Shift + 3: Full screen screenshot
Cmd + Shift + 4: Select area to capture
Cmd + Shift + 4, then Space: Capture specific window
Add Ctrl to copy to clipboard instead of saving

tips.title: Force Quit Applications
tips.description: Quickly force quit unresponsive applications.
steps: Press Cmd + Option + Esc
Select the unresponsive application
Click 'Force Quit'
Alternatively, press Cmd + Option + Shift + Esc to force quit the front app

tips.title: Split View
tips.description: Use Split View to work with two apps side by side.
steps: Hold the green maximize button on a window
Choose 'Tile Window to Left of Screen' or 'Tile Window to Right of Screen'
Click another window to fill the other side
Drag the divider to resize windows

tips.title: Terminal Shortcuts
tips.description: Essential keyboard shortcuts to boost your terminal productivity.
steps: Ctrl + C: Cancel current command
Ctrl + Z: Suspend current process
Ctrl + A: Move cursor to beginning of line
Ctrl + E: Move cursor to end of line
Ctrl + R: Search command history

tips.title: File Permissions Quick Change
tips.description: Quickly change file permissions using chmod command.
steps: Open terminal
Use 'chmod 755 filename' for executable files
Use 'chmod 644 filename' for regular files
Use 'chmod -R 755 directory' for directories recursively

tips.title: Process Management
tips.description: Monitor and manage running processes effectively.
steps: Use 'ps aux' to list all running processes
Use 'top' or 'htop' for real-time process monitoring
Use 'kill PID' to terminate a process
Use 'killall process_name' to kill all instances of a process

tips.title: Quick File Search with Find
tips.description: Use the find command to locate files and directories quickly.
steps: Use 'find . -name "filename"' to search by name
Use 'find . -type f -name "*.txt"' to find all text files
Use 'find . -size +100M' to find files larger than 100MB
Use 'find . -mtime -7' to find files modified in last 7 days

tips.title: Workspace Switching
tips.description: Efficiently switch between virtual workspaces in Linux desktop environments.
steps: Use Ctrl + Alt + Arrow keys to switch workspaces
Use Ctrl + Alt + Shift + Arrow keys to move windows between workspaces
Use Super + Page Up/Down for workspace switching in GNOME
Right-click on desktop and select workspace options to configure

tips.title: Windows Run Dialog
tips.description: Access system tools and applications quickly using the Run dialog.
steps: Press Windows + R to open Run dialog
Type 'msconfig' for System Configuration
Type 'regedit' for Registry Editor
Type 'cmd' for Command Prompt
Type 'appwiz.cpl' for Programs and Features

tips.title: Quick Look Preview
tips.description: Preview files instantly without opening them in their default applications.
steps: Select a file in Finder
Press Space bar to open Quick Look
Use arrow keys to navigate between files
Press Space again or Esc to close Quick Look

tips.title: Package Management Shortcuts
tips.description: Essential package management commands for different Linux distributions.
steps: Ubuntu/Debian: 'sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade'
CentOS/RHEL: 'sudo yum update' or 'sudo dnf update'
Arch Linux: 'sudo pacman -Syu'
Use 'which package_name' to check if a package is installed

tips.title: Task Manager Power Tips
tips.description: Advanced Task Manager features for system monitoring and troubleshooting.
steps: Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Task Manager directly
Click 'More details' for advanced view
Use 'Startup' tab to manage startup programs
Right-click on processes for additional options like 'Open file location'

tips.title: Dock Customization
tips.description: Customize your Dock for improved productivity and aesthetics.
steps: Right-click on Dock divider and select 'Dock Preferences'
Adjust size and magnification settings
Choose position: Left, Bottom, or Right
Enable 'Automatically hide and show the Dock' for more screen space
Add folders to Dock by dragging them to the right side
